docs.snippet: General Manager Dayton Moore stuck with his blueprint, emphasizing pitching, speed and defense, and now, no team may be more suited to its park than his....
docs.lead_paragraph: General Manager Dayton Moore stuck with his blueprint, emphasizing pitching, speed and defense, and now, no team may be more suited to its park than his.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that Kansas City Royals general manager Dayton Moore stuck with his blueprint, emphasizing pitching, speed and defense; he was able to take the time to implement his vision that has led Royals to the World Series.

docs.lead_paragraph: The former owner of a South Florida anti-aging clinic pleaded guilty Thursday to charges of illegally providing performance-enhancing drugs to athletes including high-profile Major League Baseball players, most notably Alex Rodriguez of the Yankees.
docs.abstract: Anthony Bosch, former owner of South Florida anti-aging clinic tied to doping, pleads guilty to charges of illegally providing performance-enhancing drugs to athletes including high-profile Major League Baseball players, most notably Alex Rodriguez.
